head.title: A Continuation of the Journal of the Forks Mackenzie's River for Summer 1807-1808. - Page #21

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #21 of 50 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Wentzel, Willard Ferdinand. A Continuation of the Journal of the Forks Mackenzie's River for Summer 1807-1808. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0022

div.p: These fellows came without their Trenches or their utensils necessary for the Trench[.] Being aware that I had designs of Sending them for Beaver[.] They excused themselves by telling me that it was too Cold & the Animals too Scarce for them to go with their families but that towards the Spring in the March they were determined to go – when they expect to make a considerable Spring Hunt[.] One of these fellows having told me that I had wronged him in trading[.] I wrung his nose & Sent him off[.] The others admitted the punishment to have been merited therefore – were not in the least affected on that Acct[.]

Saturday 13th[.] Sent off the before mentd Clan, to whom I gave no Credits untill they come to go to the Beaver Country[.] Having waited in vain these few days past for the Collet to get well in order to Send off Cadien to Mr Keith's who being troubled with the Red Knives will perhaps be greatly in want of his Services[.] I gave a yard of Common Stroud to Beaulieu for Trousers in order to Send him with the Sapin[.] The Hunters brought 76 Hares[.]

Sunday 14th[.] Gave Cadien & Beaulieu who are to sett off tomorrow morning – 50lb weight of Dried meat including 2 Cascameats & 4 Br Tails - besides 17 Hares & 2 Prs of Shoes[.] Reprimanded Martin for some H-gg-h Tricks he had played in coming from the Grand Chefre last Fall – of which I recieved information from Beaulieu[.]
Mony 15th[.] Before Sun rose Sent off Beaulieu & Cadien[.]
Tuesy 16th[.] The men busy chopping & drawing wood[.]
Wednesy 17th[.] Snowed all day[.] [N]othing else particular[.]
Thursy 18th[.] In the evening my Hunters brought 51 Hares[.]
Friday 19th[.] Ceased Snowing to day[.] Made Martin & Gibeau Clean the Fort of Snow[.] Middling Cold weather[.] Satury 10th[.]

Suny 201thst[.] Collet arrived to day with 20 Hares – says that the Robe de Castor and band are Stopped not far from the Fort by the indisposition of the Chien Brulé – who tells me is making long Strides towards the other world[.] What effect a little frivolous Sickness has upon these people – no less than 10 men are here detained from going to work on this only account[.] One of my Hunters who is byr to the afflicted old fellow, asked leave to go to See his byr while my other Hunter demands leave to go & give the finishing Stroke – for he is a Doctor of high reputation & a Surgeon of Character[.] Gave permission[.] Recieved 40 Hares from them to day[.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
